title: Experimental error while measuring final speed

content.description: A projectile of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is traveling with a horizontal speed <math alttext="v sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to the right toward a block of mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> that is at rest on a horizontal surface, as shown. The projectile becomes embedded in the block, and the block and projectile move together to the right with speed <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. There is negligible friction between the block and the surface.
content.question: Students measure <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> using a motion detector and compare the measured <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> to the expected theoretical value. What could contribute to the experimental value of <math alttext="v sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> being greater than the theoretical value?

choices.label: Greater-than-expected friction between the block and the surface
Deformation of the block as a result of the projectileâ€™s impact
Friction between the projectile and the block as the projectile becomes embedded in the block
An increase in temperature of the block as a result of the impact
A slight downward incline of the surface the block moves on

content.answer: A slight downward incline of the surface the block moves on

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
